snippet: Bilingual SEIT and Preschool, a company in Queens that teaches toddlers with disabilities, was accused by the state comptroller of tax violations, having a ghost employee and overcharges.
abstract: New York State Comptroller Thomas P DiNapoli accuses Bilingual SEIT and Preschool, Queens company that teaches toddlers with disabilities, of taking nearly $1.5 million from a public preschool program, paying themselves inflated salaries and rent, and billing the government for their personal expenses; audit is the fourth of 18 underway examining the special education program.
lead_paragraph: Bilingual SEIT and Preschool, a company in Queens that teaches toddlers with disabilities, was accused by the state comptroller of tax violations, having a ghost employee and overcharges.

headline.seo: Audit Finds Bilingual SEIT and Preschool Billed State Improperly
headline.main: Audit Finds Preschool Billed State Improperly
headline.print_headline: Audit Finds Preschool Billed State Improperly
